Final note: Obviously Vivid have opted for low compression encoding,
which in the case of this flick results in good quality. Along with the
many extras this explains why their DVD feature films are cut down to a
little over an hour length. There simply isn't any room for more footage

have done it. (Except for Private's Pyramid series.) They could make
room by losing some of the extras, but maybe most of the consumers will
never miss the cut scenes. Too bad...
